content:
is entirely up to the pro-
grammers and users of the computer. For example, on my pocket calculator



539
Philosophical Reasoning
if I print “3 3 ,” the calculator will print “9” but it has no idea that “3”
means 3 or that “9” means 9 or that anything means anything. We might put
this point by saying that the computer has a syntax but no semantics. The
computer manipulates formal symbols but attaches no meaning to them,
and this simple observation will enable us to refute the thesis of mind
